p: The effects of increasing the concentrations of the plant extracts of Pelargonium spp. ( Figure 1A) and Rhus coriaria ( Figure 1B) to inhibit α-amylase activity were assessed, aiming to evaluate the values of EC 50 (acarbose at concentration of 1.25 mM was used as a positive control). The EC 50s of Pelargonium spp. and of Rhus coriaria were 0.60 and 1.78 mg/mL, respectively. The strong α-amylase inhibitory activity indicates the presence of active compounds that could inhibit the breakdown of complex carbohydrates into oligosaccharides, which could diminish the effects of carbohydrate consumption on postprandial hyperglycemia.
